meanings.definition: to administer the Christian sacrament of baptism to
meanings.sent1: The priest baptises the baby in the church.
meanings.sent2: The pastor baptises new members in the river every summer.
meanings.sent3: The duck thought it would baptise the fish in the pond for fun.
meanings.sent4: The rain baptises the earth, bringing new life to the plants.
meanings.sent5: The sun baptises the world in its warm light each morning.

meanings.definition: to immerse in water as a religious rite
meanings.sent1: She baptises the believers in the holy river.
meanings.sent2: The priest baptises the adults by fully immersing them in the water.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally baptises its toy mouse in the water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The storm baptises the town in heavy rain, flooding the streets.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall baptises everything beneath it with its cascading waters.

meanings.definition: to initiate or dedicate someone to a new experience or belief
meanings.sent1: The mentor baptises the young artist into the world of painting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher baptises her students into the joys of reading.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully baptises the new cook into the kitchen chaos.
meanings.sent4: The mountain wind baptises the hiker with the thrill of adventure.
meanings.sent5: The first snowfall baptises the town in the magic of winter.
